chapter.title: Events - notifications from the microcontainer and services
chapter.para: The event subsystem allows services to produce and consume events.

sect1.title: Event - event abstraction
sect1.para: The Event class is intended to abstract the different event mechanisms used by different software.

sect1.title: EventEmitter - producting events
sect1.para: Event emitters produce events and send them to their registered listeners.
Listeners can be registered with a filter to filter the events they are interested in before they are sent.

sect1.title: EventListener - consuming events
sect1.para: Event listeners consume events from emitters.

sect1.title: EventFilter - filtering events
sect1.para: A filter allows events to filtered before they are sent. This is can be more efficient than filtering the event in the listener.

sect1.title: EventManager - named listening
sect1.para: The event manager allows emitters and listeners to be more detached from each other. Instead of direct registration, the names of the objects in the registry are used.
